intro: Iris ruthenica var. brevituba, commonly known as the short-stemmed Siberian iris, is a herbaceous perennial native to eastern Europe and western Asia. It features slender, upright stems that bear showy, violet-blue flowers with a distinctive white to pale blue throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and slightly hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wet meadows or along riverbanks. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
